comment: Dishonest app. It shows you a map of supposedly nearby cars, but best I can tell the cars are phoney. It always shows a car nearby and estimates 1 or 2 minutes, even when that isn't remotely true and you wait indefinitely for no taxi. Second, it doubles your tip. Drivers add the tip and when you enter that same tip into the app, the result is that your tip gets applied twice.

I really don't like that it says the drivers get the tips. When they absolutely do not. The app is ok but it's not fair to take tip money next for the driver and keep it for management. And be dishonest about it
That's why I like Uber. App sucks. 90% of the time cannot even connect, gives an error message. Tried to use it for my brief stay in Vancouver since Vancouver doesn't have Uber. Total waste of time.

author: Jeff O.
comment: I used it twice. The first cab I booked was successful after trying twice. The second I attempted 5 or 6 times before my friend just used the taxi company's own app. Not very impressive. I don't think I'll use it again.

author: Daniel Post
comment: So useless. It could be Vancouver's cab industry, maybe it's not the app's fault. But it shows many cars around, and then nothing at all when i attempt to book a car. What a waste of time.

author: Jonáš Jančařík
comment: Sometimes, when it works, you might get a better fare than with Uber when it has surge pricing. But most of the time, it will either not open at all/open but won't find your destination/will tell you your ride is booked but then basically get stuck. Seems like very little user testing has been done. Compared to Uber the whole experience is clunky and unreliable. Also, I am writing this at 2 am - you can probably tell I feel let down.

author: Brandon Coffey
comment: It takes forever for a cab to respond. The service is very inconsistent. I do not recommend.   If anything just more proof that Vancouver is in need of UBER!

author: Matt Macdonald.
comment: This app is awful. Twice has scammed me out of money. Cabs never show up. Ends up charging me anyways. Zoro was a way better app. This is garbage.

I have used this app twice. When setting up an account you had to enter a credit card. On both occasions my card was charged even if I paid the driver with a different card or cash. I have emailed a number of times requesting a refund as far back as 5th Jan & after threatening legal action they responded to say they were waiting to hear from their partner (I assume to be black & Decker cabs). 5 weeks on no refund or explanation. I will never use these again & I will be seeking information on the regulation surrounding these incidents.
Whole experience good... frustrated by the app not recognising that address where we were stood was different from initial quote. Had to cancel and reorder

author: Daniel Lazaro
comment: Horrible service in Vancouver. Estimated arrival time is not precise. Taxi "arrived" and we waited for almost 10min after calling and getting a "we will send another" that never happened.

author: Mackenzie Allsop
comment: BUYER BEWARE! This app is garbage. I tried this for the first time 9 days ago, and it's STILL searching for an available cab, and tells me it's too late to cancel the order. I get an error message when I try to delete or edit my payment information, and uninstalling and redownloading the app hasn't fixed these glitches. I've made 3 separate attempts to contact ecab over the last 9 days to insist that they cancel the order and delete my credit card information, and have received no response.

author: Georgios Damigos
comment: Unreliable half of the time crashes and when it does not the taxi never arrive on time. I strongly recommend UBER far more professional service.

author: Leonard Louie
comment: This app is garbage. It doesn't help that it is trying to bridge a gap between multiple service providers but it is horrendously flawed and full of bugs. I requested a cab and stood at the curb while I watched my phone tell me that I had been picked up two blocks away from my current location and was charged $3.20 (minimum fare is $3.30 upon entering any cab in the city) Emailing customer service for the app has proven useless as I haven't received any response at all regarding my request for a refund.   Bring in Über! At least they have a proven system that works and is a pleasure to use. Let people get around without dealing with the BS of our ridiculous taxi system.  THIS APP IS A DELETE IMMEDIATELY, WASTE OF TIME, AND DISGRACE TO DEVELOPERS!

author: Juby Samuel
comment: eCab is a poor excuse for an app. It's unfortunately the only one in Vancouver that allows you to look up more than one company's availability while trying to place an order so I've been putting up with it.  Timeline it gives you is 500% inaccurate, error messages / time outs galore, actually worse than dealing with these taxi companies themselves!

author: Tao Bror Bojlén
comment: Crashed when I tried to sign up. When I tried to order a cab, it wasn't until the very end of the process that I was told that my area isn't served by eCab. In general, confusing user experience.

author: M Chan
comment: Someone stole my cab as the driver didn't properly verify that they picked up the right person so they rode on my card. I contacted the cab company and they said that they would cancel it with ecab but ecab still charged me for the ride I didn't take. I tried contacting ecab through all electronic means because there isn't a live person to speak with and no response for two weeks. Stay away from an app that seems to be ok with defrauding its customers!

author: Chris Conrad
comment: I use it to preorder a cab in the morning and they always turn up a couple minutes early. Never had a problem.

author: Richard Cantin
comment: Doesn't work. Advertised by local cab company but it's says that it's not available here when I open the app. Epic fail

author: C Mooners
comment: Terrible App. Taxi drivers cancel on me constantly. Trying to copy the other ride sharing apps. Unfortunately it is unsuccessful.

author: christopher thieringer
comment: Only one rough experience over 4 days, and it was during rush hour in vancouver. Everything else has been great

author: Elad Nahor
comment: DO NOT USE - App is buggy and on multiple occasions takes money even when a cab never arrrives. Customer Support sends you to beg the taxi companies for refunds (and they refuse saying to talk to eCab)

author: Davis R
comment: Absolutely awful app. Ordered two cabs last night, both drivers made us pay in person once we arrived, but both payments were charged to my credit card, never using this app again.

author: Dr. Ray Hsu
comment: "An error occurred. Please try again later."  x 6 months

author: Eric Falk
comment: Literally unusable  Cannot book a cab. Cannot even register account when it forces you too.

author: Adrian McCardle
comment: Sometimes they show up sometimes not. Estimated times are terrible

author: Leonardo Grinstein
comment: App is horrible!!! Uber is desperately needed in Vancouver.

author: Jeff Churchill
comment: Thinks I live in Paris. Bombs out occasionally. Could be better.
The app is okay but the ability of taxi companies to work with it and follow through with your ride just sucks big time. I'm uninstalling it.

author: Joyce
comment: Couldn't even create an account. It said I already had one...

author: Eugen Martynov
comment: App is not ready for Marshmallow. Can not even register!

author: Fernando Loo
comment: Great cabbies but HORRIBLE app

author: Chris Callender
comment: Installed it, got a taxi within 10 mins.

author: Aurélien Ooms
comment: Perfect for trips from Brussels to Brussels Airport (38.5€ fixed price one way).

author: Roy Taylor
comment: This app sucks dickhole

author: h jacobson
comment: Does not work

author: Rob Maguire
comment: Slow and inaccurate.

author: Alan King Bowden
comment: Cabs never come

author: Sun Gill
comment: Been working great for me. Very convientant!

author: James Filippelli
comment: No solution for the Vancouver Cab Crisis.
